title: reasonable adjustments
h1: Do you have a physical, mental or learning disability or long term health condition that means you need support during your case?
hint:
We know people with disabilities sometimes need support to access information and use our services. We often call this a reasonable adjustment. Some reasonable adjustments need to be agreed by a judge, and you can discuss with the tribunal if your needs change.

Select all that apply to you - specific requirements can be given next

documents.text: I need documents in alternative formats
documents.hint: for example, braille or different colours and sizes

communicating.text: I need help communicating and understanding
communicating.hint: for example, sight, hearing, speaking or interpretation

support.text: I need to bring support with me to a hearing
support.hint: for example, someone you know or an assistance animal

comfortable.text: I need something to feel comfortable during a hearing
comfortable.hint: for example, breaks or extra space

travelling.text: I need help travelling to, or around tribunal buildings
travelling.hint: access and mobility support if a hearing takes place in person

noSupport: No, I do not need any extra support at this time
